html:
{% set terms_exist = doc.terms and (doc.terms|striptags).strip() or "" %} {% if letter_head and not no_letterhead -%}
{{ letter_head }}
{%- endif %}

Date: {{ doc.offer_date }}

Dear {{ doc.applicant_name }},

We are pleased to appoint you in the services of {{ doc.company }} on the terms and conditions detailed in this letter.

Your designation shall be {{ doc.designation }}.

{%- if doc.offer_terms -%} {%- for row in doc.offer_terms -%} {{ row.offer_term }}: {{ row.value }}
{%- endfor -%} {%- endif -%}
Please read the detailed terms as below. If you have any queries, feel free to get in touch with us. We look forward to your long and fruitful career association with our organisation. If you decide to join us, 'Welcome to {{ doc.company }} !'

Yours truly,



Authorized Signatory
{{ doc.company }}

{% if terms_exist %}
{{ doc.terms }}
{% endif %}
name: Job Offer

{{doc.total}}

name: Drop Shipping Format

html:
{{ company }}
{{ __("POS No : ") }} {{ offline_pos_name }}

{{ __("Customer") }}: {{ customer }}

{{ __("Date") }}: {{ dateutil.global_date_format(posting_date) }}

{% for item in items %} {% endfor %}
{{ __("Item") }} {{ __("Qty") }} {{ __("Amount") }}
{{ item.item_name }} {{ format_number(item.qty, null,precision("difference")) }}
@ {{ format_currency(item.rate, currency) }}		 {{ format_currency(item.amount, currency) }}
{% for row in taxes %} {% if not row.included_in_print_rate %} {% endif %} {% endfor %} {% if discount_amount %} {% endif %}
{{ __("Net Total") }} {{ format_currency(total, currency) }}
{{ row.description }} {{ format_currency(row.tax_amount, currency) }}
{{ __("Discount") }} {{ format_currency(discount_amount, currency) }}
{{ __("Grand Total") }} {{ format_currency(grand_total, currency) }}
{{ __("Paid Amount") }} {{ format_currency(paid_amount, currency) }}
{{ __("Qty Total") }} {{ qty_total }}

{{ terms }}

{{ __("Thank you, please visit again.") }}

", " ") %} {% if "GSTIN" not in company_address %} {{ company_address }} {{ _("GSTIN") }}:{{ doc.company_gstin }} {% else %} {{ company_address.replace("GSTIN", "
GSTIN") }} {% endif %} {% endif %}
{% if doc.docstatus == 0 %} {{ doc.status + " "+ (doc.select_print_heading or _("Invoice")) }}
{% else %} {{ doc.select_print_heading or _("Invoice") }}
{% endif %}

{{ _("Receipt No") }}: {{ doc.name }}
{{ _("Date") }}: {{ doc.get_formatted("posting_date") }}
{% if doc.grand_total > 50000 %} {% set customer_address = doc.address_display.replace("\n", " ").replace("
", " ") %} {{ _("Customer") }}:
{{ doc.customer_name }}
{{ customer_address }} {% endif %}

{%- for item in doc.items -%} {%- endfor -%}

@ {{ item.rate }}		 {{ item.get_formatted("amount") }}

html:
{%- from "templates/print_formats/standard_macros.html" import add_header -%}
{%- if not doc.get("print_heading") and not doc.get("select_print_heading") and doc.set("select_print_heading", _("Payment Advice")) -%}{%- endif -%} {{ add_header(0, 1, doc, letter_head, no_letterhead) }} {%- for label, value in ( (_("Voucher Date"), frappe.utils.formatdate(doc.voucher_date)), (_("Reference / Cheque No."), doc.cheque_no), (_("Reference / Cheque Date"), frappe.utils.formatdate(doc.cheque_date)) ) -%}
{{ value }}
{%- endfor -%}

{{ _("This amount is in full / part settlement of the listed bills") }}:

{%- for label, value in ( (_("Amount"), "" + doc.get_formatted("total_amount") + "
" + (doc.total_amount_in_words or "") + "
"), (_("References"), doc.remark) ) -%}
{{ value }}
{%- endfor -%}
Prepared By
Authorised Signatory
Received Payment as Above
_____________
A/C Payee
_____________
{{ frappe.utils.formatdate(doc.cheque_date) }}
{{ doc.pay_to_recd_from }}
{{ doc.total_amount_in_words }}
{{ doc.get_formatted("total_amount") }}
name: Cheque Printing Format

DELIVERY CONTACT:




INVOICING – PAYMENTS

INSTRUCTIONS FOR INVOICING:

Original invoices should be issued in favor of ONE FACILITIES MANAGEMENT and must be delivered to our premises. Send also a copy of the invoice by email to finance@one-fm.com
NOTE :Certificate of Origin and packing list should be delivered (if required).

DELIVERY CONTACT:




OTHER PARTICULAR CONDITIONS
PARTICULAR CONDITIONS

The Order Confirmation, herein “Purchase Order”, constitutes the entire agreement between the BUYER, or Buyer, and the SUPPLIER. No alteration, variation or amendment to or of the agreement hereby concluded will have any legal effect or bind the BUYER unless agreed to in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the BUYER.
In this document the expression “Goods” means the supply of goods and/or services as specified in the Purchase Order. The SUPPLIER’s Conditions of Sale shall not apply to this Purchase Order, unless specifically agreed to in writing by the BUYER.

1. ACCEPTANCE OF PURCHASE ORDERS

The Purchase Order will be effective within 5 (five) days from the date of receipt of the Purchase Order by the SUPPLIER. After this 5 (five) days period the Purchase Order will be considered fully accepted by the SUPPLIER.

2. SUPPLY AS SPECIFIED

All Goods shall be supplied strictly in accordance with the specifications as stipulated on the scope of work, drawings, requisitions or samples. No deviation or modification is permitted without BUYER’s prior agreement in writing, failing which BUYER shall be entitled to cancel the Purchase Order, return the Goods in part or in full at the SUPPLIER's expense, and recover the purchase price and any damages (excluding consequential damages) which BUYER may have suffered, notwithstanding that BUYER has accepted delivery of the Goods and has paid the purchase price thereof.

3. PACKING, MARKINGS AND DELIVERY NOTES

(a) The SUPPLIER shall adequately and securely pack the Goods, in such containers and/or in such a manner so as to prevent loss, corrosion or damage during transport and storage. Goods shall be clearly marked / tagged in accordance with the requirements of the scope of supply or Purchase Order, or applicable statutory requirements.
(b) Delivery Notes/ Waybills/ Packing Slips shall accompany every consignment and must include a full description of the consignment, order number, order title and quantities net and gross where applicable and be clearly visible for easy reference.

4. INSPECTION AND TESTING

(a) BUYER or any duly authorized third party inspection authority shall, at all reasonable times, have access to the premises and production data of the SUPPLIER or any subcontractor of the SUPPLIER, to inspect, examine and test the Goods, workmanship and condition of the manufacturing facility, prior to dispatch.
(b) Such inspection shall in no way relieve the SUPPLIER of its obligations.
(c) All Goods delivered as specified by the BUYER shall be accompanied by a Certificate of Conformance issued by the SUPPLIER, to the effect that the Goods comply with BUYER’s requirements and specifications.
(d) The supplier will at all times supply relevant certification requirements related to the specific item on the Purchase Order issued.

5. DELIVERY

(a) The SUPPLIER shall affect delivery of the Goods within the contractual time limit specified in the Purchase Order, in accordance with the quantities, quality, delivery time and conditions specified in the Order.
(b) Goods shall be delivered to the point of delivery as specified in the Order.
(c) Unless authorized by BUYER, partial shipments and partial invoices will not be accepted.

6. DELAYS

Should the SUPPLIER fail to deliver the Goods by the due date of delivery as specified in the Purchase Order, either the total supply or portion thereof, as applicable in accordance with the Order, the Buyer shall be entitled to the following remedies:

(a) BUYER shall have the right to instruct the SUPPLIER to make any alternative delivery arrangements as it may deem necessary, and all additional costs incurred shall be for the SUPPLIER's account.
(b) Apply delay penalties for each day of delay. The relevant rate and terms and maximum cumulative amount for the application of delay penalties shall have to be specified in the Order.
(c) The Supplier shall be liable to pay all the direct costs, losses and damages (excluding consequential losses) deriving from the delay.
(d) In addition to remedies under point a), b) and c) should the negative consequences of the delay to the Buyer exceed the value of the Order, BUYER shall have the right to cancel the Order. The SUPPLIER shall be liable for the additional costs deriving from this cancellation.

7. PASSING OF OWNERSHIP AND RISK

(a) Ownership of the Goods shall pass to BUYER upon delivery or payment by BUYER for the Goods, whichever is first; provided that this shall in no way preclude BUYER from returning the Goods, at the SUPPLIER’s expense, as a result of any defect or noncompliance whatsoever.
(b) All risk in and to the Goods shall pass to BUYER, upon delivery of the Goods in accordance with the Purchase Order.

8. DEFECTS

If any of the Goods purchased in terms of the Purchase Order are found to be defective in quality, workmanship, (including Goods damaged because of unsatisfactory packaging) or being unfit for the purpose for which they were required, then, notwithstanding acceptance of delivery of, or payment for, such Goods by BUYER, BUYER shall have the right:

(a) To reject and return such Goods to the SUPPLIER at the SUPPLIER's risk and expense and to recover the purchase price paid for such Goods.
(b) To rectify any of the rejected Goods at the SUPPLIER's expense and upon request, to require replacement of any of the rejected Goods without additional cost to BUYER.
(c) Defective or not compliance Goods will not be considered delivered as per Art. 5 until rectified and/or replaced at the satisfaction of the BUYER.

9. PATENT RIGHTS - INDEMNITY

The SUPPLIER shall be deemed to have given to the Buyer an irrevocable, non-terminable, transferable, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to copy, use and communicate the documents provided by the SUPPLIER in relation with the Order and the Goods, including making and using modifications of them, for the purposes of completing, operating, maintaining, altering, repairing, adjusting or demolishing the works related to the Order and the Goods.
The SUPPLIER shall indemnify BUYER against any claims made against it for infringement of patent rights, trademarks or protective rights in respect of Goods supplied and against all costs and damages.

10. CONFIDENTIALITY

The SUPPLIER undertakes that neither itself nor its employees shall disclose to any other party any information concerning BUYER and/or the Project relevant to the supply of the Goods. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, confidential information shall include details relating to BUYER's plant, its equipment, its operations and processes, its technologies, data, its commercial, financial or legal affairs, and all information, documents, specifications, drawings related to the Project.

11. ETHICS

The SUPPLIER shall adhere to the highest standard of business ethics and, in particular, shall ensure that none of its officers, employees, or agents will make, provide or offer gifts, or other considerations to employees or agents of BUYER, or receive the same without BUYER’s management approval, this preferably in writing. No payments or loans will be entertained and should be brought to management’s attention immediately.

12. PURCHASE PRICE/PAYMENT

The quoted price shall be fixed and invariable until the final and complete supply of the Goods, and shall include all costs, duties, fees and insurance. The price shall include the cost of delivery, unless specifically priced and indicated to the contrary. No charges other than those specified on the Purchase Order will be paid by BUYER.
Payment by BUYER will be effected in accordance with the terms stated on the Purchase Order and subject to the receipt of a correct invoice.

13. ESCALATION

There will be no escalation in the price of Goods unless this is agreed to in writing by BUYER. Additional materials required must be subject to a signed approved Variation Order, Purchase Order or Change Order issued and approved prior to proceeding with any supply. Supply provided without the proper procedure being followed is at risk and will not be paid for.

14. WARRANTIES

(a) The SUPPLIER warrants that the Goods will be fit for the purpose for which they were sold and will be free from all patent or latent defects of any nature whatsoever for at least 12 (twelve) months from the date of installation.
(b) All common law warranties which would apply to the sale of Goods shall apply in addition to the warranties and undertakings contained in or referred to or incorporated into these conditions.
(c) Any guarantee provided by the SUPPLIER in relation to the Goods supplied will be transferable to the final owner of the works in which the Goods will be incorporated or intended for.

15. ASSIGNMENT SUBCONTRACTING

The SUPPLIER shall not assign and/or subcontract any portion of the Supply without prior approval of the BUYER. The SUPPLIER shall not transfer the credit.

16. GOOD FAITH

In carrying out their obligations under this Purchase Order, the Parties will act in accordance with the principles of good faith and fair dealing.

17. FORCE MAJEURE

Delay, or total or partial failure of any Party to perform any obligation under this Purchase Order, shall not constitute default, suspension or termination hereunder or give rise to any claim for damages if and to the extent such delay, suspension or failure is caused by any force majeure event occurring beyond the reasonable control of the affected Party, provided that:

(a) The Supplier gives written notice to the Buyer of the circumstances constituting the event, not later than 3 (three) calendar days after the occurrence of the event and of the obligation or performance which is thereby delayed or prevented.
(b) The Supplier gives written notice of the impact of the event on the dates in the Time Schedule to the Buyer, not later than 3 (three) calendar days after the start of the event, together with an estimate of the potential duration of the event.

18. TERMINATION

The BUYER is entitled to cancel the Purchase Order or part of it at any time, subject to the payment to the SUPPLIER of the documented cost incurred up to the time of cancellation, unless the cancellation is due to default of the SUPPLIER.

19. APPLICABLE LAW & LANGUAGE

The Laws of the State of Kuwait shall govern this agreement. Any communication and documentation relevant to the Purchase Order shall be in English language unless otherwise specified.

20. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Unless capable of being resolved by amicable settlement within 30 days from the first notice given in writing by any of the Parties, any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Purchase Order, including any question regarding its existence, validity or termination, as well as any of the rights and/or obligations of any party thereto, shall be referred to and finally resolved by Local competent Court having jurisdiction. No dispute or litigation either during the currency of the contract or after the completion thereof, shall release the Supplier from its obligations in terms of this Purchase Order, unless released there from by the Buyer, in writing.
name: Supplier Purchase Order PF
